body:
Hi @nicolargo, 

[shutil_get_terminal_sizeis in setup.py ](https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/5.x/setup.py#L208) and looking at the the pip freeze you gave, it is installed. 

The lines you pasted (`sudo pip install`) and the result are concerning though:

```
$ sudo pip install --upgrade ipython
The directory '/home/nicolargo/.cache/pip/http' or its parent directory is not owned by the current user and the cache has been disabled. Please check the permissions and owner of that directory. If executing pip with sudo, you may want sudo's -H flag.
The directory '/home/nicolargo/.cache/pip' or its parent directory is not owned by the current user and caching wheels has been disabled. check the permissions and owner of that directory. If executing pip with sudo, you may want sudo's -H flag.
```

pip should almost never be used with sudo. By doing that you are fighting system installed packages that may end up breaking your python install (or worse), it is better to use `pip install --user`.

With the error message you got, you likely have broken in some way the `backports` namespace package which you seem to have two part on your system:

```
backports.shutil-get-terminal-size==1.0.0
backports.ssl-match-hostname==3.5.0.1
```

You will likely need to clean that up, and figure out why `import backports.shutil-get-terminal-size` is corrupted (it's likely not corrupted itself, it might be backport or backports.ssl-match-hostname that is).

That's likely means poking around `/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/backports`, removing everything that should not be there and restoring files that were replaced by pip by the original ones. I'm unsure how to do that though. You'll have to dig into `apt` and `dpkg` likely. 

@takluyver you use linux. Any advices ?

> @takluyver you use linux. Any advices ?

Other than *kill namespace packages with fire* :fire: ?

- If practical, use Python 3, which avoids needing the backport in the first place
- Run [this debugging script](https://gist.github.com/takluyver/73cf4e7e7cff4d95f3b23ea80d59bcab) and post the output. A number of people have had this problem, and so far I haven't been able to pin down the cause.

@takluyver here is the output of the debugging script:

```
mod: <module 'backports' (built-in)>

backports.__path__ = ['/home/nicolargo/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/backports']

-- Found /home/nicolargo/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/backports --
Files: ['configparser']
No __init__.py found

-- Found /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/backports --
Files: ['__init__.py', '__init__.pyc', 'shutil_get_terminal_size', 'ssl_match_hostname']
__init__.py contains:
from pkgutil import extend_path
__path__ = extend_path(__path__, __name__)


-- Found /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/backports --
Files: ['__init__.py', '__init__.pyc', 'ssl_match_hostname']
__init__.py contains:
# This is a Python "namespace package" http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0382/
from pkgutil import extend_path
__path__ = extend_path(__path__, __name__)
```
Can you try copying one of those `__init__.py` files that it found to the location where it didn't find one?
Thanks! That's a couple of people who've fixed it in the same way. Maybe we're finally starting to zero in on what's going wrong here.

i just had to comment out 
```python
try:
    from shutil import get_terminal_size as _get_terminal_size
except ImportError:
    # use backport on Python 2
    pass
    # from backports.shutil_get_terminal_size import get_terminal_size as _get_terminal_size
```

I solved the problem by this way in my Mac ! 
Thanks !  

@gr1d99 

But when input '?' in ipython console, the problem is remain there:

```

In [2]: ?
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/Users/young/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/__init__.py", line 119, in start_ipython
    return launch_new_instance(argv=argv, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/young/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/traitlets/config/application.py", line 658, in launch_instance
    app.start()
  File "/Users/young/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/terminal/ipapp.py", line 348, in start
    self.shell.mainloop()
  File "/Users/young/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/terminal/interactiveshell.py", line 440, in mainloop
    self.interact()
  File "/Users/young/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/terminal/interactiveshell.py", line 431, in interact
    self.run_cell(code, store_history=True)
  File "/Users/young/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/core/interactiveshell.py", line 2717, in run_cell
    interactivity=interactivity, compiler=compiler, result=result)
  File "/Users/young/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/core/interactiveshell.py", line 2846, in run_ast_nodes
    self.showtraceback()
  File "/Users/young/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/core/interactiveshell.py", line 1824, in showtraceback

  File "/Users/young/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/core/ultratb.py", line 1314, in structured_traceback
    self, etype, value, tb, tb_offset, number_of_lines_of_context
  File "/Users/young/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/core/ultratb.py", line 1164, in structured_traceback
    tb_offset)
  File "/Users/young/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/core/ultratb.py", line 1107, in format_exception_as_a_whole

  File "/Users/young/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/core/ultratb.py", line 1041, in prepare_header
    width = min(75, get_terminal_size()[0])
  File "/Users/young/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/utils/terminal.py", line 121, in get_terminal_size

NameError: global name '_get_terminal_size' is not defined

If you suspect this is an IPython bug, please report it at:
    https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues
or send an email to the mailing list at ipython-dev@scipy.org

You can print a more detailed traceback right now with "%tb", or use "%debug"
to interactively debug it.

Extra-detailed tracebacks for bug-reporting purposes can be enabled via:
    %config Application.verbose_crash=True
```

please do like this, it works:

/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages$ vi IPython/utils/terminal.py

try:
    from shutil import get_terminal_size as _get_terminal_size
except ImportError:
    # use backport on Python 2
    #from backports.shutil_get_terminal_size import get_terminal_size as _get_terminal_size
    from shutil_backports import get_terminal_size as _get_terminal_size

Even after trying all the suggestions from above, nothing worked for me.

So, if you are someone who has a similar problem, the following worked for me eventually :- 

- Get a list of all your installed packages using pip freeze > requirements.txt
- Make a new virtualenv with the **--no-site-packages** flag
- Install all the packages from the requirements file using pip install --upgrade -r requirements.txt

Clearly, somehow a stale/corrupted site-package was messing things up; installing everything from scratch works like a charm.
We hope that we'll have worked around this problem for 5.4 - see PR #10587.
